content.raw: The code in the function looks very similar to `BulletJoint::SetPosition`. Should the code be moved up a level to `Joint::SetPosition` if it's not doing ODE/Bullet specific stuff?
content.html: The code in the function looks very similar to BulletJoint::SetPosition. Should the code be moved up a level to Joint::SetPosition if it's not doing ODE/Bullet specific stuff?

content.raw: I wanted to make it clear that SetPosition is a physics engine specific call, so wanted to keep them inside of ODE/Bullet.
content.html: I wanted to make it clear that SetPosition is a physics engine specific call, so wanted to keep them inside of ODE/Bullet.

content.raw: I agree with @iche033 ; I don't like repeated code. What if we made a protected method called `Joint::SetPositionMaximal` that is called by ODEJoint and BulletJoint? This way, it's not part of the public API, but it can be shared between the two physics engines. Also, since it's not virtual, I think it won't impact ABI.
content.html: I agree with @iche033 ; I don't like repeated code. What if we made a protected method called Joint::SetPositionMaximal that is called by ODEJoint and BulletJoint? This way, it's not part of the public API, but it can be shared between the two physics engines. Also, since it's not virtual, I think it won't impact ABI.

content.raw: good suggestion 16c18b7. ABI is not an issue here, as gazebo 4.0 is not yet released.
content.html: good suggestion 16c18b7. ABI is not an issue here, as gazebo 4.0 is not yet released.

content.raw: This looks like much the same code as another pull request. What's the reason behind two pull requests?
content.html: This looks like much the same code as another pull request. What's the reason behind two pull requests?

content.raw: two different implementation approaches.  Pull request #1096 needed to adhere to abi restrictions, being a "fix" to released code.  This approach does the same thing but is potentially cleaner, it breaks API/ABI since the target is unreleased.
content.html: two different implementation approaches. Pull request #1096 needed to adhere to abi restrictions, being a "fix" to released code. This approach does the same thing but is potentially cleaner, it breaks API/ABI since the target is unreleased.

content.raw:
thanks, your testing and comment helps :)

btw, what's your use case?
content.html:
thanks, your testing and comment helps :)

btw, what's your use case?

content.raw:
We have some robots with either
a very precise 'external' dynamic model
or
where dynamics do not matter (slowly moving industrial with light load) because they can be regarded as static position controlled.
In both cases we use custom model plugins to set the joint positions in each simulation step (with physics disabled).

The other use case is #!/osrf/gazebo/issue/1072/allow-to-set-initial-joint-pose-in-sdf, which I might implement myself.
content.html:
We have some robots with either a very precise 'external' dynamic model or where dynamics do not matter (slowly moving industrial with light load) because they can be regarded as static position controlled. In both cases we use custom model plugins to set the joint positions in each simulation step (with physics disabled).

The other use case is #!/osrf/gazebo/issue/1072/allow-to-set-initial-joint-pose-in-sdf, which I might implement myself.
